Package ca.on.oicr.gsi.shesmu.plugin

Class Parser

java.lang.Object
ca.on.oicr.gsi.shesmu.plugin.Parser
public abstract class Parser extends Object
Parse an input stream

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static final class 
    Parser.ParseDispatch<T>
    Allow the parser to try several possible branches and return the first one that matches
    static interface 
    Parser.Rule<T>
    Parses a particular section of grammar that emits a known type of result
    static interface 
    Parser.RuleWithLiteral<T,V>
    A parse rule that can also generate a syntax node for a pre-determined literal value

      Scan a series of binary operators (e.g., +/-)
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the nodes
      Parameters:
      child - the parser for the terms
      condensers - the rules to coalesce terms
      input - the input parser
      output - the output term handler

    • keyword

      public abstract Parser keyword(String keyword)
      Parse a keyword

      A keyword is different from a symbol(String) because a keyword cannot be followed by alphabetical characters.

    • keyword

      public final Parser keyword(String keyword, UnaryOperator<Parser> ifFound)
      Check for a keyword and parse more if found; if not, remain unchanged
      Parameters:
      keyword - the keyword to look for
      ifFound - the parse action to perform if found

    • list

      public final <T> Parser list(Consumer<List<T>> output, Parser.Rule<T> childParser, char separator)
      Parse a character-delimited list

      The list must have at least one item.

      The list may have no items.

    • symbol

      public abstract Parser symbol(String symbol)
      Parse a symbol

      The next character after the matched symbol can be any character.

    • then

      public final <T> Parser then(Parser.Rule<T> rule, Consumer<T> output)
      Parse a rule

      This is to make long parse blocks read left-to-right.

      public abstract Parser whitespace()
      Consume and comments or white space in the input.
